resources.string: p o n d e r
h a l f m o o n
S t u d i o s
Ponder is your mobile source of written inspiration. Designed for moments where you need a change in mood, our team at
has sourced powerful quotes from notable figures, literature and texts. Whether it be finding inner peace or motivating yourself, Ponder is an app designed for the human condition.

A grateful heart is a beginning of greatness. It is an expression of humility. It is a foundation for the development of such virtues as prayer, faith, courage, contentment, happiness, love, and well-being.
Self-esteem is as important to our well-being as legs are to a table. It is essential for physical and mental health and for happiness.
Wellness is the compete integration of body, mind, and spirit - the realization that everything we do, think, feel, and believe has an effect on our state of well-being.
Well-being cannot exist just in your own head. Well-being is a combination of feeling good as well as actually having meaning, good relationships and accomplishment.
The simplification of life is one of the steps to inner peace. A persistent simplification will create an inner and outer well-being that places harmony in one\'s life.
The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one\'s own even more, one\'s own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.
No man, who continues to add something to the material, intellectual and moral well-being of the place in which he lives, is left long without proper reward.
If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.
More compassionate mind, more sense of concern for other\'s well-being, is source of happiness.

Human well-being is not a random phenomenon. It depends on many factors - ranging from genetics and neurobiology to sociology and economics. But, clearly, there are scientific truths to be known about how we can flourish in this world. Wherever we can have an impact on the well-being of others, questions of morality apply.
Start by doing what\'s necessary; then do what\'s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible
The best and the most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart
Stop trying to hit me and hit me
Everything looks better in the morning
Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence
I can\'t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination
Nothing is impossible, the word itself says \'I\'m possible\'
Bran thought about it. \'Can a man still be brave if he\'s afraid?\' \'That is the only time a man can be brave,\' His father told him
The glow of one warm though is to me worth more than money
What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you
It is in health that is real wealth and not pieces of gold and silver
To keep the body in good health is a duty, otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear

Being in control of your life and having realistic expectations about your day-to-day challenges are the key to stress management, which is perhaps the most important ingredient to living a healthy, happy and rewarding life
Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise
Health is not valued until sickness comes
A healthy attitude is contagious but don\'t wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier
The wish for health has always been half of health
Healing is a matter of time but it is also a matter of opportunity
If you\'re happy, if you\'re feeling good, then nothing else matters
Grief does not change you, Hazel. It reveals you.
I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil.
Don’t grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them
No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear
They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite
Grief is not as heavy as guilt, but it takes more away from you
To weep is to make less the depth of grief
Grief can be a burden, but also an anchor. You get used to the weight, how it holds you in place
Libraries were full of ideas–perhaps the most dangerous and powerful of all weapons.
Daring ideas are like chessmen moved forward. They may be beaten, but they may start a winning game
An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
No army can withstand the strength of an idea whose time has come

Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life, think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of though

If you haven\'t found it yet, keep looking. Don\'t settle. As with all matters of the heart, you\'ll know when you find it. And, like any great relationship, it just gets better and better as the years roll on

If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange these apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.
And the idea of just wandering off to a cafe with a notebook and writing and seeing where that takes me for awhile is just bliss.
